page.title: 09PEMBROKE POWER STATION
page.content: {Pembroke Power Station}is outside the grid that we have studied,but it has many implications for our area. It is one of the reasons for the large traffic flow through{Pembroke, {Monkton}and{Hundleton. The station contributes to the National Grid through a system of high pylons supporting overhead power lines.These pylons are very prominent features and pass right through the area we have studied. Britain's population is increasing more rapidly in the south and there is an increasing demand for electricity in that area.The answer has been to build coalburning stations close to coalfields and oilburning stations close to their source of fuel.The electricity is then carried south by the overhead transmission lines.
